resources.string: My Kingdom for a Horse
The son of a legendary warlord has built a stable in hopes that the return of the Beast Lords will mean he can put his horse training skills to use.

There is nothing here for you, stranger. A stable without a horse is like a garment without buttons.\n\nBut one day soon, this paddock will swell with the sound of hoofbeats. I swear it, by the banner of my father.

Do you sense it, stranger? Something changed. I can feel it in the beat of the horse hooves.\n\nThe primal spirits of this land are returning. They were once called “Beast Lords.” And I believe with their return, what was impossible is now possible.
"What are you hoping to accomplish?"

I knew you had a warrior's heart. Long ago, my brothers stole my inheritance from me. On that day, I swore I would prove the blood of my father flowed through my veins by taming the Takhi-- the ancient spirit horses of heaven.\nI believe someone with a warrior's soul can now claim such a beast.
"What would this 'someone' need to do?"

I found this land where no one had mounted a horse in millennia. I came here to tame what is untamable.\n\nThere was a cult of the Beast Lords near Walsham. Perhaps they left some clue there. Will you aid my search?
"I'll check it out."
It will take more than keen senses to conquer this mystery, stranger. \n\nThe bond between horse and rider is sacred. One soul, two bodies. Remember this when you search.
Investigate the area by the lake for signs of the Beast Lords
Commune with the Beast Lords at the mural
Scared? If you’re afraid, don’t go. But if you’re going, don’t be afraid.

What’s this? After all this time, are there still humans on this island that revere the primal forces? \n\nIf you wish to bond with the spirit of the beast, you must find an offering that demonstrates your soul is truly wild.
What’s this? After all this time, are there still humans on this island that revere the primal forces?
If you wish to bond with the spirit of the beast, you must find an offering that demonstrates your soul is truly wild.

Do you realize what we’ve done, stranger? This changes everything. Look here, spirits of my ancestors: we have brought the horse to Aeternum! \n\nMay the blood of my father ride forever beneath the Eternal Blue Sky!
Path of the Old Warrior
Reach all checkpoints\n(Optional: Hold {$player.mount_dash$} to Dash)
Reach all checkpoints
Jochi has set up a practice race to test the mettle of your steed. Go to the starting location and leap over the crate to begin the race.
The bond between horse and rider is sacred. Treat it well, and it will carry you far, across many battlefields and to many victories.\n\nBut forging such a bond takes time and effort.
"How do I strengthen the bond with my horse?"

My people learn to ride at age two, and start racing at age six. I hope you're at least as skilled as our children. Let's find out.\n\nI have arranged a practice race for you. Head to the starting line to test your skills.
"What sort of race is it?"
This type of race is called a 'rally': a short-distance course meant to test your speed.\n\nThere are a hundred roads to glory, if your horse is fast enough.
"Any tips?"
Stay aware of your surroundings and use your map to determine a swift route. Any spirit travel will disqualify you.\n\nYou may find shortcuts and hidden paths, if your eyes are keen enough.
"I'm ready."
Good luck, my friend. Fate is kinder to the bold. If you want to build high, first dig deep.\n\nI’ll see you when you’re finished.
Open Moonshadow reward from inventory
You have already done the impossible, my friend. Do not begin to doubt yourself now. It is no matter if you fall seven times, so long as you have the strength to rise eight.
Return to Jochi Khan
I knew you had it in you! Push your limits and your skills will continue to grow.\n\nNow that the bond between man and beast has been rekindled, you'll find challenges from other racers. Be prepared.
"How can I keep my horse strong?"
In the wild, horses eat grass. A racing horse is a rare breed. The importance of this bond must be recognized.\n\nCraft the right vittles and you'll soon find your horse swift and eager as wildfire.
Jochi has given you the ingredients to make Basic Mount Vittles. Craft them at any kitchen or campsite.
Hungry as a Horse
Craft Mount Vittles at the Camp
Equip Vittles then mount and feed your Horse

You can conquer the world from the back of a good horse, my friend. Take care of your mount, and it will take care of you. \n\nHere is a recipe my father taught me. It will keep your mount strong for the racing season.
"Don't horses eat grass?"
In the wild? Yes. But a racing horse is a special breed. With proper care, a good mount will carry you swiftly past the horizon.
A lazy rider wins few races, my friend. See to it that your horse is fed, and then we’ll talk.

Well done! Your horse looks strong and eager. But a bond is forged through many hours in the saddle.\n\nI have posted races at notice boards throughout the area. These will push the limits of your potential.
You've shown a rare aptitude for horsemanship, I think even my forefathers would be impressed. But trust between horse and rider is something that is built over time.
"And these races will do that?"
They will. The times I've posted are challenging, but pushing youself and your steed to beat those will forge trust between the two of you.\n\nGood luck.
Between Horse and Rider
Jochi Khan has asked me to build a bond between me and my horse by completing the Warrior's Path Circuit.
Don't be intimidated by the tracks. They are meant to be difficult, but that difficulty will make you both stronger.\n\nShow me you can do them.
You've returned! And I can already see a stronger rider before me.
"I bested your times!"

Your skills are impressive. There is nothing more to teach. Now experience will be your tutor.\n\nI have a heard of a man called “Francois” who also keeps a stable. Challenge him and you will learn what you have not yet learned.
"So this Francois can teach me more about riding?"

Francois is a… unique individual, from what I have come to understand. But his horsemanship is second to none, and he likes to prove that with difficult races.\n\nMeet with him, and you'll see what I mean.
Hoofing It
Seek out Francois De La Rama in Weaver's Fen for additional races.
Keep an eye on Francois when you find him in Weaver's Fen. He is talented, but he may be a little… hard to trust.
Find Francois de La Rama in Weaver's Fen [Recommended Player Level: 35]
Return to Francois de La Rama
Well well, what have we here? A dusty rider on a broken mare? Or are you something more?\n\nI think I know who you are. Jochi's new friend, no?

You’re improving. Your horse trusts you. I see it in the calm of his breath and the snap of his gait. But it takes much to impress me, my friend. \n\nSeek out more challenging races, and soon I’ll think you were born in the saddle.
Beg your pardon, but I haven’t heard of you. This is a private competition, friend. Invite only. Go make a name for yourself, and maybe we’ll talk.

Ah… I’ve been wondering when you would show up. They say you’re not one to back down from a challenge.\n\nWell, I have a challenge for you. A ride for the ages across some of Aeternum’s most mysterious thoroughfares.
"I'll accept that challenge."
"Those races were easy as bamboozling an infant."

So I have heard. But Jochi is a romantic in love with the idea of rider and mount as one.\n\nI live under no such delusions. I only care what you can bring to the table. So show me. I want to see what you can do.
You can quit if you would like. These tracks are not for the faint of heart.\n\nI suspect you are not the kind to do that, though.

You ride like the wind, stranger. I admit, I did not expect to lose. C’est la vie… \n\nI have heard tales of Varangian knights astride great wolves. Can you imagine such a thing? Find them, and perhaps you can learn their secret.
Remember to watch your step around the Varangian… that order has a strict set of ethics, and you never know what might set them off.
"You suggest I seek out a Varangian for training?"
On the Scent

François de La Rama has asked that I seek out a Varangian named Valencia Iznov, saying she might have the secret to riding wolves. I should look for her in Great Cleave and see if I can earn her trust.

If you'd like to continue your training, that's exactly what you need to do. I've dealt with this Varangian before - Valencia Iznov is her name.\n\nShe and I didn't part ways on the umm, best of terms, but she's different than others like her.
"I see. Anything else I should know?"

Like I said, mind yourself, and find a way to earn her trust. Do that, and she may show you what she knows about riding.\n\nOr she might try to run you through. I really was never sure with her. Good luck.
Last time I saw her, Valencia was up in Great Cleave. I can't promise she's still there, but that's your best bet.
Find Valencia Iznov in Great Cleave [Recommended Player Level: 45]
Return to Valencia Iznov
Stay yourself, stranger! I have no qualms about sending a wayward traveler back to their spirit shrine the hard way!

Back again, friend? I already admit defeat. A good smuggler always knows when the jig is up!\n\nBut Aeternum is rife with challenges and obstacles. I'm sure you can find other races to keep your heart pounding!
A Pack of Knaves
A defector of the Varangian Order seeks aid to free a pack of dire wolves from her former compatriots.
I don’t know you, outsider. Didn't your mother teach you not to talk to sullen, well-armed strangers? Do not speak to me unless you've got something useful to say.
"My wolf and I have cleared your challenges."
Now what are you doing here? Speak quickly!
"I sought you out to learn the secrets of wolf riding."
Then you are very naïve or very foolish. The pack is broken, and the trust of the wolves is lost. No one will be riding them again.
"What happened to them?"
My former comrades, cursed be their names, have brought disgrace on our people. Varangians reserve our wrath for our enemies.\n\nWe do not abuse and subjugate the wonders of the natural world.
"I see, your old friends upset their balance."

The wolves of Misty Borough are swift as the wind. But their predatory spirit must be nurtured. My brethren seek to cage and dominate them. They've imprisoned three wolves.\n\nIf you free my pack, I will teach you how to take one as your mount.
"I'll set them free."
Good luck, warrior! Do not underestimate my kinsmen.
You tarry while our wolf-brothers languish in chains? Free the pack first, then we'll talk.
You've freed the wolves! The natural order is restored. Look for one with a compatible spirit, and I will arrange a race to push the limits of your partnership.

Hail to you and your pack, champion. The wolves remember your scent. \n\nThere are races in the wild that you can conquer to test your spirit and resolve. Stay strong, stay fearless, and your mount will always acknowledge you as alpha.
Wolves are pack animals, and will only follow those they deem to be capable. If you're going to bond with your wolf, you will need to show them you are worth their respect.
Bonding with Wolves
In order to better bond with my wolf, I need to run the circuit set up by Valencia Iznov.
"I could race with them to show what I've learned."

That would certainly work. The pack is swift and strong, and showing the wolf that you can guide them would prove you are capable.\n\nI have set up a series of challenging races near here that you can use for that purpose. Come back to me when you've finished them.
My races are difficult, but they are meant to be. The wolves need to know your strength.
You and your wolf are now of one spirit. But further challenges will strengthen your bond. I have heard of a woman who seeks out the island's greatest champions. Perhaps it is time your legend grows.
You've bested my races, but there is always room to grow. This woman, Satiah Rahmotep, has revived a set of courses from… lifetimes ago.
"Where can I find her?"

Brimstone. I'll put the spot on your map. I've never run these races myself, but if she is to believed, they are second to none. With your wolf by your side, though, I'm sure you can master them.\n\nUntil we meet again, friend.
Desert Dash
Satiah Rahmotep is collecting a book of records of Aeternum. She has laid out truly challenging courses for those riders who would seek immortal fame.
Look for Satiah out in Brimstone. I'd be more specific, but the desert heat is not for me.\n\nOh, and bring plenty of water for your pack.
Find Satiah Rahmotep in Brimstone Sands [Recommended Player Level: 60]
Return to Satiah Rahmotep
Ah, and who is this before? Not a mirage, I should hope! Whew, the heat will get to you quick out here.
This is a place for champions, hero. You are admired for a great many things, but expertise as a rider is world unto itself. Prove yourself in some of Aeternum’s other races, then we’ll talk.

Hail to you, champion. I am Satiah, a chronicler of Aeternum’s finest. Even immortals require a legacy.\n\nWould you be willing to undertake a challenge to preserve what you have learned for the next generation of castaways?
"I hear you found courses once thought lost to time."

I have! And those that lived here before certainly expected much from their competitors. From what I have heard, though, you are not one to be underestimated.\n\nI'd like to see you challenge the times of the ancient ones.
"I am up to the challenge."
I should hope that you are! If you're able to conquer the courses, return to me. Perhaps I will write about you.
Challenge the race times set by Satiah Rahmotep, and prove you can beat the times set by the ancients.
I know those times seem difficult, but remember, they were set by those whose legends have lasted for lifetimes. Prove that you deserve to stand among them.
You've come back! And I cannot believe it, you've beaten times that have stood for milennia!\n\nOh, I knew there was something special about you… I can't wait to compose a story about this!

I have never seen a rider of your skill, hero. But there is a rumor… whispers of an island to the south, off the coast of what we used to call First Light.\n\nThey say the creatures there are swifter than the wind in a squall.

I cannot imagine a human rider that is your equal, champion. But there are deeper mysteries in this strange and terrible land.\n\nPerhaps someone, or something, out there in the wild can still challenge a rider of your considerable mastery.
"Elysian Wilds. I hear it's dangerous."
It is, and it probably seems like it is hardly the place to compete in races. But the creatures that thrive in that environment… I've heard they move like no other.
"The Beast Lords. What do you know of them?"

If you want to become the greatest rider in Aeternum, I believe they are the ones to show you how.\n\nThere is a name that is known to me - Zinnumun. I know little about her or her nature, but I do know that she respects the swift. Find her.
A Matter of Pride
Satiah Rahmotep has suggested that I seek out Zinnumun in the Elysian Wilds to further my riding training.
I have never been to Elysian Wilds, so I can't tell you what to expect.\n\nBut no one would understand how to ride an animal better than the animals themselves, and so it is there that you must go.
Find Zinnumun in Elysian Wilds [Recommended Player Level: 65]
Return to Zinnumun
What is this before me? A human deep in the territory of the Beast Lords? Perhaps I should… \n\nAh, but wait… something about your scent is familiar. I think I know who you are.
The Lion's Lament

Zinnumun, matriarch of the Elysian lions, summons Aeternum's greatest hero to liberate her mate Kaluru from the clutches of pretender Lion Lords that seek to end the growing alliance between man and beast.
You are either very brave or very mad, human. Most of your kind do not dare offer warm greetings to a mighty hunter such as myself.
You are either very brave or very mad, human. Most of your kind do not dare offer warm greetings to a mighty hunter such as myself.

Greetings, human. I have heard you are a friend to beasts. My mate, Kaluru, is welcoming to your kind. And for that, the would-be lion lord twins, Zurvān of Moon’s Shadow and Sun’s Wing hold him in bondage.\n\nWould you honor his bond with your people?
"I will free him. Where are these Zurvān??"
Their den lies just a short sprint ahead. But be cautious: they are skilled hunters. Free him, and you will have earned my bond as well.
Travel to Shirzad's Pride to rescue Kaluru
Follow the path to Isle of Zurvān
Search for the secret to bridge the gap to Isle of Zurvān
Use the Lion Rune to activate the bridge
Cross the bridge
Return to Zinnumun and Kaluru
You’re back? I don’t see my mate. Perhaps your skills as a hunter are exaggerated.
"I'm a skilled hunter, too."
Then may Shirzad bless your hunt, human.
Another human who believes he is a master of beasts. Pathetic. Aeternum was once place of balance
and tranquility, before the arrival of you and your 'gods.' You will learn what it means to be true hunter!

All this time, I believed humans understood only dominance. But now I owe every free breath I take to you.\n\nYour heart beats with a lion's pride. I will let all my kind know, you are friend to the wilds.
Before your kind arrived in this land, we lions were known as the king of beasts. All creatures, great and small, bowed to our majesty.\n\nThe world has changed now… for all of us.
Because of you, my darling Kaluru runs free. You have proven you have the heart of a lion. Should you require aid, call to me, and I will answer.

Back again, friend human? The lions remember your service.\n\nPerhaps you should test your bond with our kind by seeking out some of this land's most challenging races. There is no greater teacher than experience.
Now, what is it that I can do for you, friend human?
"I've come to learn to be a rider without peer."

I see… well, as you have proven yourself on many occasions to be a friend of our kind, we will grant you this favor.\n\nThere is no greater teacher than experience, though, and that is what I will give you.
"What is it I need to do?"

There is a series of courses that we lions use to teach our young to be swift and agile. I will see to it that these are set up on a way that you can understand as a human.\n\nBeat those times, and you will learn what you need to.
Zinnumun has set me to train on the same courses they use to teach their young. I must show I can match or beat the times set by hunting lions.
We expect much from our young. If you are going to stride alongside lions, you must show you can keep up with the pride.
You're come back, every bit as capable as a member of our tribe.\n\nI commend you, friend human. There are few of your kind that could accomplish what you have. Go forth, and use your bonds wisely.
Equip your Horse then mount it with [X]
Hermit's Rally
{timeRemaining}
Get to the destination within the time limit.
Read Race Rules
"Accept."

Race from ___ to ___ if you dare, adventurer! Finish in <par time> if you want my respect. Now, ride like the wind!\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Riding Level 50]
Go to the starting line on horseback
Reach the top of Preservation Pass {timeRemaining}
Rally of the Gods
Get to the destination within the time limit.
"Rally of the Gods"
This race runs from ____ to ____. Finish before <Par time> and make history!\n\n [Recommended Riding Level 150]
"Accept."
Go to the starting line on horseback
Reach the checkpoint
Island Tour
Get to the destination within the time limit.
"Island Tour"

(There is a muddied claw print on the signpost. you can make out an 'X' mark at ___ for the starting line and another for the end at _____ <par time>).\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Riding Level 200]
"Accept."

(There is a muddied claw print on the signpost. you can make out an 'X' mark at ___ for the starting line and another for the end at _____ <par time>).\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Riding Level 200]
Commune with the Beast Lords
Harvest azoth infused oats
Search for horse to bond with
This appears to be a horse. One can never be sure though…
The horse is calmly licking its lips looking for a snack. Perhaps if you offer it something…..
[Feed oats]
The horse takes the oats and whinnies gratefully. It nudges your hand sniffing you. You feel a bond forming with it.
Investigate Varangian treatment of the wolves
Search the Varangian base for key to wolf cages
Search chests for the {itemName}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Free Kaluru from captivity
Unlock the northern cage
Unlock the western cage
Unlock the southern cage
Discover the entrance to the mysterious island
Speak with Kaluru
You hear pitiful wheezing and heavy panting. This wolf has been beaten and burned, it is barely holding onto life.
"Can you explain riding?"

Summon - [Default: X], Canter - [Default: CTRL], Dash - [Default: SHIFT], Jump - [Default: SPACE]\n\nDashing and Jumping cost mount stamina. Falling from great heights and taking heavy hits from enemies will dismount you.
"Why did you build this stable?"

My former paramour and I used our knowledge of the Ancient light bridges to move goods for very private clientele.\n\nBut it was too much looking over my shoulder. I organize horse races now. At least when I’m riding I know who’s chasing me.
"What is it like to train Dire Wolves "
Wolves are easier than humans. They do not feel greed or pride or envy. Simply show courage, show yourself to be the natural leader of the pack, and they follow.
"Do you know the best route?"
Oh, I can't take sides, hero. That wouldn't be sporting. But you seem capable enough. But the fastest riders have knowledge of hidden glyphs and the Ancient bridges.
"Do you trust humans?"

Your kind are not like us. Mother Earth has not given you a natural instinct to follow. Some, like yourself, are as constant as the tides. Others are capricious, like a leaf on the wind. I trust who I can and am wary of others.
"What was the island like before mankind arrived?"
This lion looks severely malnourished. You can hear him whimpering.
You see a posting board. It looks useful, though nothing is posted to it yet.
Fast traveling will disqualify you from the trial. If your time expires the trial will reset. You may only have one trial at a time.
Follow the road south through lush forests and busy trade routes onward to the ivory walls of Artorias's court.\n\nEnds at Prydwen Castle in Monarch's Bluffs.

King's Road Tour

"The King's Road is paved with tears." - Ser Gawain

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Player Level: 25, Riding Level: 0-49</font>
Travel south from the Syndicate's shadowy enclave to past a bridge of the damned and end at the glimmering temple of the Covenant.\n\nEnds at Covenant Shrine in Everfall.

Dogma Tour

"All Theologies share one road." - The Corpse Crone

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Player Level: 25, Riding Level: 0-49</font>

Ghosts and Groves Tour

"The only ghosts I fear are those I carry in my head." - Leovix Silva

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Player Level: 25, Riding Level: 0-49</font>

Radiant Hills Rally

"Do not let the radiance of the hills fool you. Danger lurks even on the brightest of days." - Ser Galahad

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Player Level: 25, Riding Level: 0-49</font>

Stolen Shores Rally

"There's no such thing as heroes. Only coin and those smart enough to take it." - Grace O' Malley

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Player Level: 25, Riding Level: 0-49</font>

Wend your way up and down over the glowing hills of Everfall. You will dash by fortifications and spiked defenses. The sun is out and it's a beautiful day for a skirmish.
Descend into the pirateship graveyard of Stolen Shores, weaving in and out of the wreckage of fools who sought glory.
Wend your way up and down over the glowing hills of Everfall.\n\n"Do not let the radiance of the hills fool you. Danger lurks even on the brightest of days." - Ser Galahad

Descend into the pirateship graveyard of Stolen Shores, weaving in and out of the wreckage of fools who sought glory.\n\n"There's no such thing as heroes. Only coin and those smart enough to take it." - Grace O' Malley

Fast traveling will disqualify you from the race. If your time expires the race will refresh so you may attempt it again. You may only have one race at a time.

Iron Rose Tour

"Valor is a beacon. May we live each day of our immortal lives better than the last.” -Ser Merrill

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Player Level: 35, Riding Level: 50-99</font>

Thieves' Way Tour

"Who knows what treasures lie buried beneath the ground we trot or the hearts we hide.” -Francois de La Rama

The doomed mercenary company used this path to build endurance. Though they have all but perished, this road holds their memory.\n\nEnds at Iron Rose Shrine in Windsward.
A path for stealing both gold and hearts. Take care plotting your course else you may find yourself lost like so many souls who have chosen the thieves' way.\n\nEnds at Syndicate Shrine in Everfall.
Forge a path through the flooded villages. The windmills still spin though their citizens have long gone Lost. Any road out of the swamp is the right road.\n\nEnds at the bridge south of Fenton.

Iron Rose Tour II - The doomed mercenary company used this path to build endurance. Ends at Iron Rose Shrine in Windsward.\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Player Level: 35, Riding Level: 50-99</font>

Thieves' Way Tour II - A path for stealing both gold and hearts. Ends at Syndicate Shrine in Everfall.\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDD">Recommended Player Level: 35, Riding Level: 100-149</font>

Flood and Folly Tour II - Cut through the flooded fen and find your path to the finish line south of Fenton in Weaver's Fen.\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Player Level: 35, Riding Level: 100-149</font>

Iron Rose Tour III - The doomed mercenary company used this path to build endurance. Ends at Iron Rose Shrine in Windsward.\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Recommended Player Level: 35, Riding Level: 150-199</font>
A path for stealing both coin and hearts.\n\nEnds at Syndicate Shrine in Everfall.
Cut through the flooded fen and find your path to the finish line just south of Fenton in Weaver's Fen.\n\n
Travel along and under the majestic Vega Bridge. Take care on the boardwalks and make your way to Fenton without being caught by the restless dead.\n\nEnds at the bridge south of Fenton.
Learn the acrobatic triumph of high diving if you dare. Watch out for ghosts and find a perch just after the windmill. Only the most daring of smugglers dive to the water below.
Travel along and under the majestic Vega Bridge. Take care on the boardwalks and make your way to Fenton./n/nEnds at the bridge south of Fenton.
Learn the acrobatic triumph of high diving if you dare.\n\n

This note is covered in mud. There doesn't seem to be anything written on it right now.
This note is covered in mud. There doesn't seem to be anything written on it right now.\n\nYou must own the Elysian Wilds Expansion and be level 25 to access this quest.
To the strong of heart and fleet of foot,\n\nA change in the wind has happened. An awakening not seen since the old world.
<continue reading>
If you wish to learn more, come find me at my stable. You'll find me in the north part of Everfall, near Walsham.\n\n- Jochi Khan
A Change in the Wilds
I've found a stained note from someone named, "Jochi." It mentions something of an 'awakening,' and asks to meet him at a… stable?
Look for Jochi's Stable in North Everfall
If you wish to learn more, come find me at my stable. You'll find me in the north part of Everfall, near Walsham.\n\nJochi
Ah! You are welcome here, weary traveler. What can I offer you? Food? A place to rest?
I found your note.
Well then, there is something more I can offer you... if you'll stay to hear my tale.
Read Mud-Stained Note

Dash out of the snowy reaches of Great Cleave to the green hills of Edengrove.\n\nEnds at Fabhcon shrine.
Dash down the mountainside and south to an unsuspecting Varangian fortress.\n\nEnds at Pennine shrine in Brightwood.
Stay true on the path and follow it south through snow and silence.\n\nEnds at Wolfsegg Shrine in Brightwood.

Take in the light drenched cliffs of Ebonscale Reach as you gallop across sparkling sands and serene skylines.\n\nEnds at Pilgrim's Rest.
Ride through landscapes painted with summer, winter, fall, and spring.\n\nEnds at the Shrine of Orion in Mourningdale.
Use your growing knowledge of the northern courses to plot a route to Reekwater.\n\nEnds at Siren's Run.
Take in the light drenched cliffs of Ebonscale Reach.\n\nEnds at Pilgrim's Rest.
Ride through landscapes painted with summer, winter, fall, and spring.\n\nEnds at the Shrine of Orion in Mourningdale.
Use your growing knowledge of the northern courses to plot a route to Reekwater.\n\nEnds at Siren's Run.
The great pyramid, the mercury pools, and the settlement - the ancient gods look over everything in eternal splendor.\n\nEnds at New Corsica in Brimstone Sands.
Make your way through gorgeous flora, a spirit filled graveyard, and a fortress of the corrupted.
The great pyramid, the mercury pools, and the settlement - the ancient gods look over everything in eternal splendor.\n\nEnds at New Corsica in Brimstone Sands.
Make your way through gorgeous flora, a spirit filled graveyard, and a fortress of the corrupted.
Ride back to where your journey with beastkind began.\n\nEnds at Jochi's Stable in Everfall.
Island Tour - Test your true mettle with the fearlessness of a lion.\n\nEnds at Deadman's Shrine in Monarch's Bluffs.
Ponder the mysteries of Aeternum through along a route wrought with clandestine whispers.\n\nEnds at Syndicate Enclave in Everfall.
Descend into the wild greens of Beast Lord stomping grounds, leap beyond the clutch of hungry teeth, and make your way back to Last Light.
Dash through green rolling hills and the tunnels of Tempestas Custodia for the ultimate test of your agility.
